title: Cherub
summary: A cherub (/ËˆtÊƒÉ›rÉ™b/;[1] plural  cherubim; Hebrew: ×›Ö°Ö¼×¨×•Ö¼×‘â€ kÉ™rÅ«á¸‡, pl. ×›Ö°Ö¼×¨×•Ö¼×‘Ö´×™× kÉ™rÅ«á¸‡Ä«m, likely borrowed from a derived form of Akkadian: ğ’…—ğ’Š’ğ’ karÄbu "to bless" such as ğ’…—ğ’Š‘ğ’ kÄribu "one who blesses",[2] a name for the lamassu) is one of the unearthly beings who directly attend to God, according to Abrahamic religions.
